Package org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.cli

Class BaseCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.cli.AbstractCommand
      • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.cli.BaseCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Command
    public abstract class BaseCommand
extends AbstractCommand
    A command that groups a list of subcommands that can be executed separately.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public int execute​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Description copied from interface: Command
        Executes the command with the give arguments. The command must support being interrupted by the user (by interrupting the caller thread).
        Parameters:
        args - the command arguments. The command name is not part of the arguments.
        Returns:
        the exit status of the execution

      • addSubCommand

        protected void addSubCommand​(java.lang.String name,
                             java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String[],​java.lang.Integer> action,
                             java.lang.String description)
        Creates and adds a new subcommand to the list of subcommands supported by this command.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the subcommand
        action - the action to run when the the subcommand is executed
        description - the description of the subcommand
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a subcommand of the given name already exists

      • addSubCommand

        protected void addSubCommand​(CommandFactory factory)
        Adds the given subcommand to the list of subcommands supported by this command.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory for a new subcommand of this command
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a subcommand of the given name already exists
